case_data.name: Kaiser v. County of Sacramento
case_data.plaintiff_description: Prisoners at the Sacramento County Jail and the Rio Cosumnes Correctional Center.
settlement_agreement: Court Approved Settlement or Consent Decree
case_data.summary:
On March 12, 1991, prisoners at two Sacramento County jails filed a class action complaint in the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of California against the County of Sacramento. The plaintiffs, represented by the Prisoner Rights Union and by private counsel, brought suit under 42 U.S.C. ยง 1983, challenging the constitutionality of their conditions of confinement. Specifically, they alleged problems with overcrowding, failure to provide beds, unequal access for women prisoners, lack of exercise, inadequate access to medical, dental and mental health treatment, and lack of law library access. Plaintiffs sought declaratory and injunctive relief.

On April 5, 1991, the Court (Judge William B. Shubb) granted a preliminary injunction prohibiting the County from sleeping inmates on the floor. The Court (Judge Gregory G. Hollows) partially granted a subsequent motion for a preliminary injunction on June 3, and denied a third motion on August 16. (The substance of the injunction requested in each motion is unclear from the docket.) It mostly denied a fourth motion, in which plaintiffs sought an order compelling the County to give them physical access to the jail law library, on November 20, 1991, but did order the County to post a list of available law materials in the jail's dayrooms. Kaiser v. Cnty. of Sacramento, 780 F. Supp. 1309 (E.D. Cal. 1991).

On December 6, 1991, the Court (Judge Hollows) denied a motion to dismiss by the County and granted a motion by the plaintiffs to certify the case as a class action.

Discovery continued over the course of the following year, with the Court compelling the County to disclose documents and respond to other discovery requests on several occasions and granting an interim award of attorneys' fees and costs to plaintiffs.

On November 17, 1992, plaintiffs requested a settlement conference, and the parties began to work on a settlement with the help of Magistrate Judge John F. Moulds. Discovery disputes continued, and defendants filed a motion for partial summary judgment on December 14. They filed an additional motion for summary judgment on the issue of opportunity to exercise on December 22.

On January 28, 1993, the Court (Judge Hollows) approved a proposed consent decree. Under the terms of the decree, the County agreed that it would not house more than 2,000 prisoners in the main jail, that it would maintain its law library and allow access on reasonable notice, that it would assign female prisoners to the main jail as workers on a voluntary basis only, and that it would provide regular access to medical and dental care and regular opportunities to exercise. The County also agreed to pay $140,000 in attorneys' fees.

The Court entered final judgment on March 3, 1993.

On July 15, 1998, the County moved to terminate or amend the consent decree. The parties agreed to an amendment, the content of which is unclear from the docket, on August 31, 1998.

The County moved again to amend the consent decree on October 17, 2008, seeking to replace the law library with a contracted legal research service and to allow psychiatric patients to be housed at one of the facilities covered by the decree. The Court (Judge Hollows) granted the motion as to the housing of psychiatric patients on October 27, 2009. The consent decree was further modified on March 7, 2013, removing books from the law library and replacing them with computers. Inmates objected to this modification, stating that some inmates did not know how to use computers. The Court held that this objection was not an issue because computerized research is similar to using an index to search for relevant materials. In the same holding, the Court denied a class member's motion to intervene. On July 16th, 2013, the case was assigned to U.S. District Court Judge William B. Shubb and U.S. Magistrate Judge Gregory Hollows. As of February 7, 2020, there has been no further activity in this case.
case_data.summary_short: This is a class action brought by prisoners in two Sacramento County jails challenging the constitutionality of their conditions of confinement. After the District Court for the Eastern District of California granted limited preliminary relief for overcrowding conditions and certified the proposed class, the parties settled. The County of Sacramento agreed to, among other things, a population cap at the main jail, access to the law library and dental and medical care, and regular opportunities to exercise. The decree has been amended numerous times, with the most recent amendment in 2013.

documents.title: Amended Order [Denying Plaintiffs' Motion for a Preliminary Injunction Ordering Prisoners Be Given Physical Access to the Law Library]
documents.text:
6/20/12 This Document is Provided by Leagle.com
KAISER v. COUNTY OF SACRAMENTO
780 F.Supp. 1309 (1991)
Joseph Walter KAISER, et al., Plaintiffs,
v.
COUNTY OF SACRAMENTO, et al., Defendants.
No. CIV S-91-0300 GGH P.
United States District Court, E.D. California.
December 6, 1991.
Paul W. Comiskey, Prisoner's Rights Union, Sacramento, Cal., Richard Herman, Balboa Island, Cal.,
Paul Persons, Chico, Cal., Mark E. Merin, Dickstein & Marin, Sacramento, Cal., Dan Stormer,
Hadsell & Stormer, Los Angeles, Cal., for plaintiffs.
Michele Bach, Steven Kaiser, County Counsel's Office, Sacramento, Cal., for defendants.
 
AMENDEDยORDER
GREGORYยG.ยHOLLOWS,ยUnitedยStatesยMagistrateยJudge.
ThisยmatterยcameยonยregularlyยNovemberย7,ย1991,ยforยhearingยonยplaintiffs'
motionยforยaยpreliminaryยinjunctionยtoยprovideยadequateยaccessยtoยlawยbooks,
  legalยmaterialsยandยlegalยassistanceยfromยotherยinmates.ยPaulยComiskeyยand
Richardย Hermanย appearedย forย plaintiffs.ย Micheleย Bachย andย Stevenย Kaiser
appearedยforยdefendants.ยHavingยnowยreviewedยtheยrecordยandยheardยoralยargument,ยtheยcourt
issuesยtheยfollowingยorder.
BACKGROUND
Onย Marchย 12,ย 1991,ย plaintiffsย filedย theย underlyingย complaintย inย thisย action,ย challengingย the
conditionsยofยconfinementยatยtheยSacramentoยCountyยJail.1ยPlaintiffs'ยclaimsยincludeยallegationsยof
overcrowding,ยfailureยtoยprovideยbeds,ยunequalยaccessยforยwomenยprisoners,ยlackยofยexercise,
inadequateยaccessยtoยmedical/mentalยhealth/dentalยtreatmentยandยlackยofยlawยlibraryยaccess.ยThisยis
plaintiffs'ยfourthยmotionยforยinjunctiveยrelief.ยAtยissueยinยtheยinstantยmotionยisยwhetherยplaintiffsยare
entitledย toย preliminaryย injunctionย onย theirย claimsย ofย inadequateย accessย toย theย lawย library/legal
assistance.ยSpecifically,ยplaintiffsยareยseekingยanยorderยfromยtheยcourtยcompellingยdefendantsยto
provideยphysicalยaccessยtoยtheยlawยlibrary.ยPlaintiffsยhaveยsubmittedยfourยdeclarationsยinยsupportยof
theirยinjunctiveยreliefยrequest.ยMostยofยtheยplaintiff'sยcomplaintsยconcernยtheยpresentย"slip"ยorย"request"
systemยforยobtainingยlegalยresearch.
JosephยKaiserยclaimsยthatยheยwasยincarceratedยatยtheยSacramentoยCountyยJailย(hereinafter
referredยtoยasย"theยMainยJail")ยfromยOctoberย12,ย1990,ยtoยapproximatelyยMayย30,ย1991,ยandยatยRio
Cosumnesย(hereinafterยreferredยtoยasย"RCCC")ยfromยMayย30,ย1991,ยtoยJulyย30,ย1991.ยHeยstatesยthat
heยwasยdeniedยphysicalยaccessยtoยtheยlawยlibraryยandยwasยrequiredยtoยuseยaย"slip"ยorย"request"
system.ยKaiserยstatesยthatยheยonlyยreceivedยhisยrequestsยoneยoutยofยfourยtimesยandยthatยtheยbooks
wereยoftenยoutdated.ยKaiserยalsoยstatesยthatยdefendantsยfailedยtoยallowยhimยtoยcommunicateยwithยthe
www.leagle.com/PrintDocument.aspx 1/9

6/20/12 This Document is Provided by Leagle.com
jailhouseยlawyers.
JosephยHamburgยhasยbeenยincarceratedยatยtheยSacramentoยCountyยJailยsinceยMarchย10,ย1991.
Heยisยrepresentingยhimselfยinยhis
[ย780ยF.Supp.ย1311ย]
criminalย proceedingsย becauseย heย claimsย theย publicย defenderย wasย notย providingย adequate
representation.ยPlaintiffยclaimsยthatยheยhasยobtainedยsomeยassistanceยfromยjailhouseยlawyers.ยPlaintiff
alsoยcontendsยthatยheยisยunableยtoยupdateยtheยcaseยlaw.2
RonaldยMarksยhasยbeenยincarceratedยatยtheยSacramentoยCountyยJailยsinceยSeptemberย23,ย1991.
Heยisยrepresentingยhimselfยinยhisยcriminalยproceedingsยbecauseยhisยpastยexperienceยwithยpublic
defendersย showsย thatย theyย doย notย haveย adequateย timeย toย defendย him.ย Plaintiffย contendsย that,
becauseยofยhisยinadequateยaccessยtoยtheยproperยlawยbooks,ยheยwasยprejudicedยatยhisยpreliminary
hearing.ยAdditionally,ยplaintiffยclaimsยthatยheยdoesยnotยknowยwhatยbooksยareยavailableยasยdefendants
haveยfailedยtoยprovideยaยlistยofยtheirยlegalยmaterials.ยMarksยalsoยstatesยthatยheยhasยnoยaccessยtoยthe
jailhouseยlawyersยbecauseยtheyยhaveยbeenยmovedยtoยotherยfloors.
SydneyยOldenยhasยbeenยincarceratedยatยtheยSacramentoยCountyยJailยsinceยJulyย5,ย1991.ยHe
statesยthatยheยhasยnoยaccessยtoยtheยjailhouseยlawyersยnorยanyยphysicalยaccessยtoยtheยlawยlibrary.
Oldenยcontendsยthatยtheยslipยsystemยforcesยtheยinmatesยtoยprovideยtheยexactยcite.ยTheยlackยof
physicalยaccessยisยfurtherยcompoundedยbyยtheยfactยthatยnoยlistingยofยlegalยmaterialsยisยavailableยtoยthe
inmates.
ANALYSIS
I.ยPreliminaryยInjunctionยLegalยStandards
Theยgeneralยlegalยprinciplesยapplicableยtoยaยrequestยforยpreliminaryยinjunctiveยreliefยareยwell
established.ยToยprevail,ยtheยmovingยpartyยmustยshowยeitherย"(1)ยaยlikelihoodยofยsuccessยonยtheยmerits
andยtheยpossibilityยofยirreparableยinjury,ยorย(2)ยtheยexistenceยofยseriousยquestionsยgoingยtoยtheยmerits
andย theย balanceย ofย hardshipsย tippingย inย [theย movingย party's]ย favor."ย Oaklandย Tribune,ย Inc.ย v.
ChronicleยPublishingยCo.,ยInc.,762ยF.2dย1374,ย1376ย(9thยCir.1985),ยquotingยAppleยComputer,ยInc.ยv.
FormulaยInt'l,725ยF.2dย521,ย523ย(9thยCir.1984)อพยseeยalsoยHartikkaยv.ยUnitedยStates,754ยF.2dย1516,
1518ย(9thยCir.1985).ยTheยtwoยformulationsยrepresentยtwoยpointsยonยaยslidingยscaleยwithยtheยfocalยpoint
beingยtheยdegreeยofยirreparableยinjuryยshown.ยOaklandยTribune,ย762ยF.2dยatย1376.ย"Underยeither
formulationยofยtheยtest,ยplaintiffยmustยdemonstrateยthatยthereยexistsยaยsignificantยthreatยofยirreparable
injury."ยId.ยInยtheยabsenceยofยaยsignificantยshowingยofยirreparability,ยtheยcourtยneedยnotยreachยtheยissue
ofย likelihoodย ofย successย onย theย merits.ย Id.ย However,ย whereย anย injunctionย seeksย toย remedyย a
constitutionalยviolationยandยaffectยtheยoperationยofยstateยorยlocalยgovernment,ยthereยareยadditional
considerations.
Generally,ยirreparableยharmยisยpresumedยifยaยviolationยofยtheยconstitutionยisยshown.ยGoldie's
Bookstore,ยInc.ยv.ยSuperiorยCourtยofยtheยStateยofยCalifornia,739ยF.2dย466,ย472ย(9thยCir.1984).ยBut
whereยaยfederalยinjunctionยisยsoughtยagainstยaยgovernmentalยentity,ยtheยpartyยrequestingยreliefยmust
showยaยthreatยofย"greatยandยimmediate,"ยnotยconjecturalยorยhypothetical,ยirreparableยharm.ยCityยofยLos
Angelesยv.ยLyons,461ยU.S.ย95,ย 113,ย 103ย S.Ct.ย 1660,ย 1671,ย 75ย L.Ed.2dย 675ย (1983)อพย seeย also,
OrantesยญHernandezยv.ยThornburgh,919ยF.2dย549,ย557ย(9thยCir.1990).ยTherefore,ยinยtheยinstantยcase,
plaintiffsยmustยshowยaยlikelihoodยofยreal,ยimmediateยandยnonยญconjecturalยviolationsยofยconstitutional
rightsยbeforeยtheยcourtยwillยapplyยtheยpresumptionยofยirreparableยharm.
Oneยfinalยpointยconcerningยtheยlastยprerequisiteยforยinjunctiveยrelief,ยtheยbalanceยofยhardships,
www.leagle.com/PrintDocument.aspx 2/9

6/20/12 This Document is Provided by Leagle.com
mustยbeยmade.ยAยfindingยofยirreparableยharmยinยtheยconstitutionalยsenseยdoesยnotยalsoยgiveยriseยtoยa
presumptionยthatยtheยhardshipsยentailedยwithยanยinterlocutoryยinjunctionยfavorยtheยpartyยclaimingยthe
constitutionalยviolations.ยAยfactualยshowingยmustยbeยmadeยcontrastingยtheยharmยtoยbeยsufferedยbyยthe
movingยpartyยifยanยinterlocutoryยinjunctionยisยnot
[ย780ยF.Supp.ย1312ย]
issuedยwithยtheยharmยtoยbeยsufferedยbyยtheยdefendingยpartyยifยinjunctiveยreliefยisยordered.ยTheยdifficulty
inยthisยassessmentยisยthatยtheยharmsยareยnotยoftenยofยtheยsameยtype.ยOneยparty'sยconsiderationsยmay
beยfinancialยinยnatureยwhileยanotherยisยattemptingยtoยprotectยanยintangibleยright.ยTheยdifferencesยinยthe
natureยofยtheยharmsยtoยbeยsufferedยinยthisยcaseยclassicallyยillustrateยtheยpoint.ยWhileยitยisยtrueยthat
fiscalยconstraintsยcannotยserveยasยanยexcuseยtoยavoidยclearยlegalยobligations,ยMillerยv.ยCarlson,768
F.Supp.ย1341,ย1343ย(N.D.Cal.ย1991),ยinยinterlocutoryยinjunctiveยreliefยsituationsยdemonstratingยonly
"seriousยquestions,"ยaยcourtยshouldยbeยhesitantยtoยimposeยheavyยfinancialยobligationsยonยaยpartyยprior
toยaยfullyยdevelopedยrecord.
II.ยProceduralยArguments
Defendantsยhaveยraisedยaยnumberยofยproceduralยargumentsยwhichยtheยcourtยwillยaddressยbefore
proceedingยtoยtheยmeritsยofยplaintiff'sยrequestยforยinjunctiveยrelief.ยSpecifically,ยdefendantsยchallenge
plaintiffs'ยstanding,ยpleadingยandยclassยcertification.
First,ย defendantsย claimย thatย plaintiffsย lackย standingย toย challengeย theย adequacyย ofย theย law
library/legalยassistanceยbecauseยtheyยhaveยfailedยtoยallegeยanyยactualยinjuryย(i.e.,ยtheyยlostยaยcaseยin
wholeยorยinยpart).ยDefendants'ยargumentsยconcerningยstandingยandยpleadingยareยerroneousยunder
Sandsยv.ยLewis,886ยF.2dย1166ย(9thยCir.ย1989).ยInยSands,ยtheยNinthยCircuitยclarifiedยtheยpleading
requirementsยforยaยrightยofยaccessยclaim:ย"...ยifยoneยofยtheยcoreยrequirementsยunderยBoundsย is
involvedยโยtheยadequacyยofยlawยlibrariesยorยlegalยassistanceยโยthenยthereยisยnoย`actualยinjury'
requirement."ยId.ยatย1171.ยHere,ยplaintiffsยhaveยmetยtheยstandingยrequirementยbyยallegingยthatยthey
were,ยorยwillยbe,ยdeniedยaccessยtoยanยadequateยlawยlibraryยandยhaveยbeenยdeniedยaccessยtoยlegal
assistance.ย Plaintiffs'ย claimsย thatย theyย areย deniedย accessย toย anย otherwiseย adequateย libraryย is
scrutinizedยasยoneยofยtheยcoreยrequirementsยofยBounds.ยSee,ยToussaintยv.ยMcCarthy,801ยF.2dย1080,
1109ย(9thยCir.1986).ยThus,ยplaintiffsยinยtheยinstantยcaseยhaveยstandingยtoยchallengeยlawยlibrary/legal
assistanceยaccess.3
Inยaddition,ยdefendantsยclaimยthatยtheยpleadingยofยplaintiffs'ยthirdยamendedยcomplaintยisยdeficient.
Defendantsยnoteยthatยplaintiffsยhaveยonlyยallegedยthatยtheyยwereยdeniedยaccessยtoยtheยlawยlibraryยand
haveยfailedยtoยstateยthatยtheyยwereยalsoยdeniedยaccessยtoยalternativeยlegalยassistance.ยHowever,
plaintiffsยneedยonlyยallegeย"oneยofยtheยcoreยrequirementsยunderยBounds"ยinยorderยtoยstateยaยclaimยfor
whichยreliefยcanยbeยgranted.ยSands,ย886ยF.2dยatย1171.ยThus,ยplaintiffsยinยtheยinstantยcaseยhave
satisfiedยtheยpleadingยrequirementsยmerelyยbyยallegingยdenialยofยaccessยtoยanยadequateยlawยlibrary.4
Finally,ยdefendantsยcontendยthatยclassยญwideยinjunctiveยreliefยwouldยbeยinappropriateยasยtheยcourt
hasย notย yetย certifiedย theย class.ย Theย courtย hasย provisionallyย certifiedย theย classย pursuantย to
Fed.R.Civ.P.ย23(b)(2)ยpendingยmodificationยorยdecertificationยshouldยitยbecomeยclearยthatยtheยclassยis
notยmaintainable.ยSeeยAprilย5,ย1991ยOrder.5ยAccordingly,ยtheยcourtยmayยcontinueยtoยgrantยinjunctive
reliefยonยaยclassยญwideยbasis.
III.ยRightยofยAccessยtoยtheยCourts
Itยisยwellยsettledยthatยstatesยmustยensureยindigentยprisonersยmeaningfulยaccessยtoยtheยcourts.
Boundsยv.ยSmith,430ยU.S.ย817,ย828,ย97ยS.Ct.ย1491,ย1498,ย52ยL.Ed.2dย72ย(1977).ยInยBounds,ยplaintiffs,
incarceratedยinmatesยinยtheยstateยprisonยsystem,ยfiledยcivilยrightsยactionsยclaimingยthatยtheยstateยhad
www.leagle.com/PrintDocument.aspx 3/9

6/20/12 This Document is Provided by Leagle.com
deniedยplaintiffsยreasonableยaccessยtoยtheยcourtsยbyยfailingยtoยprovideยadequate
[ย780ยF.Supp.ย1313ย]
accessยtoยaยlawยlibrary.ยTheยdistrictยcourtยheldยthatยtheยsoleยprisonยlibraryยwasยseverelyยinadequate
andยmustยbeยmadeยadequate,ยbutยthatยtheยstateยwasยnotยrequiredยtoยprovideยlegalยassistanceยin
additionยtoยanยadequateยlibrary.ยTheยCourtยofยAppealsยaffirmedยtheยdistrictยcourt'sยjudgmentยinยall
materialยrespects,ยandยtheยSupremeยCourtยinยturnยaffirmedยtheยjudgmentยofยtheยCourtยofยAppeals.ยThe
Courtยheldยthatยtheยconstitutionalยrightยofยaccessยtoยtheยcourtsยrequiresยprisonยauthoritiesยtoยprovide
prisonersยeitherยwithยadequateยlibrariesยorยadequateยassistanceยfromยpersonsยtrainedยinยtheยlaw.ยId.
atย 828,ย 97ย S.Ct.ย atย 1498.ย Theย Courtย furtherย notedย thatย whileย adequateย lawย librariesย areย one
constitutionallyย acceptableย methodย ofย assuringย meaningfulย accessย toย theย courts,ย theyย doย not
forecloseยalternativeยmeansยofยachievingยthisยgoal.ยId.ยatย830ยญ832,ย97ยS.Ct.ยatย1499ยญ1500.
TheยNinthยCircuitยhasยdeterminedยthatยaยpagingยsystemยinยaยstateยprisonยfacilityยisยinsufficientยto
guaranteeยprisonersยtheยrightยofยaccessยtoยtheยcourts.ยToussaintยv.ยMcCarthy,801ยF.2dย1080,ย1109ยญ
1110ย(9thยCir.1986).ยTheยunconstitutionalยpagingยsystemยinยToussaintยconsistedยofยaยprocessยin
whichย theย correctionalย staffย providedย prisonersย withย requestedย lawย booksย asย anย alternativeย to
physicalยaccessยtoยtheยinstitution'sยlawยlibrary.ยHowever,ยaยjailยfacilityยservesยdifferentยpurposesยthan
aยstateยprison,ยwhichยhouses,ยforยtheยmostยpart,ยconvictedยprisoners.ยTheยmajorityยofยpersonsยinยneed
ofยaยlawยlibraryยinยaยjailยsettingยwouldยbeยthoseยpersonsยawaitingยtrialยonยcriminalยoffenses.
AtยissueยinยtheยinstantยcaseยisยwhetherยBoundsยandยitsยprogenyยapplyยwithยequalยforceยtoยpreยญtrial
detaineesยasยtheyยapplyยtoยconvictedยprisoners.ยTheยprimaryยissueยhereยcentersยaroundยtheยinterplay
betweenยtheยrightยofยaccessยtoยtheยcourtsยguaranteedยbyยBoundsยandยToussaintยwithยtheยrightยofยselfยญ
representationยguaranteedยbyยFarettaยv.ยCalifornia,422ยU.S.ย806,ย95ยS.Ct.ย2525,ย45ยL.Ed.2dย562
(1975).ยMoreยspecifically,ยtheยcourtยmustยconsiderยwhetherยaยprisonerยmayยinsistยonยeitherยphysical
accessยtoยaยlawยlibraryยorยaccessยtoยnonยญlawyerยtrainedยlegalยassistanceยonceยtheยcourtยoffersยto
appointยaยlawyerยforยtheยprisoner'sยcase.ยInยaddition,ยasยtheยprovisionallyยcertifiedยclassยconsistsยof
bothยpretrialยdetaineesยandยconvictedยprisoners,ยtheยcourtยwillยalsoยdiscussยtheยdifferingยrightsยof
thoseยprisonersยwhoยhaveยbeenยsentenced,ยbutยremainยincarceratedยinยtheยSacramentoยCountyยjails
(eitherยtheยMainยJailยorยRCCC).
IV.ยProยPerยPreยญtrialยDetainees6
Defendantsย correctlyย contendย thatย theย extentย toย whichย Boundsย createsย rightsย forย preยญtrial
detaineesยwhoยassertยtheirยrightยofยselfยญrepresentationยremainsยunsettled.ยMiltonยv.ยMorris,767ยF.2d
1443,ย1446,ยn.ย2ย(9thยCir.1985).ยInยMilton,ยaยprisonerยfiledยaยfederalยhabeasยpetitionยclaimingยdenialยof
dueยprocess.ยPetitionerยhadยchosenยtoยrepresentยhimselfยinยhisยoriginalยcriminalยtrialยratherยthan
acceptยappointedยcounsel.ยPetitionerยwentยtoยtrialยwithoutยhavingยaccessยtoยresearchยmaterials,
advisoryยcounsel,ยmeansยtoยserveยsubpoenas,ยorยeffectiveยuseยofยaยtelephone.ยPetitionerยchallenged
hisยconvictionยonยtheยgroundsยthatยheยhadยbeenยdeniedยtheยrightยofยselfยญrepresentationยandยtheยrightยof
meaningfulยaccessยtoยtheยcourts.ยTheยdistrictยcourtยdeniedยhisยpetition,ยbutยtheยNinthยCircuitยreversed
theยjudgmentยofยtheยdistrictยcourtยandยremandedยwithยinstructionsยtoยgrantยtheยpetition.
TheยNinthยCircuitยheldยthatยtheยoutcomeยofยtheยcaseยwasยdeterminedยbyยtheยSixthยAmendment
andยtheยSupremeยCourt'sยholdingยinยFarettaยv.ยCalifornia,422ยU.S.ย806,ย95ยS.Ct.ย2525,ย45ยL.Ed.2d
562ย(1975).ยInยFaretta,ยtheยCourtยheldยthatยaยcriminalยdefendantยhasยaยconstitutionalยrightยofยselfยญ
representationยwhichยallowsยoneยtoยmakeยone'sยownยdefenseยpersonallyยwithoutยtheยassistanceยof
counsel.ยId.ยFollowingยFaretta,ย theย Ninthย Circuitย heldย thatย atย aย minimumย theย Sixthย Amendment
guaranteedยa
[ย780ยF.Supp.ย1314ย]
www.leagle.com/PrintDocument.aspx 4/9

6/20/12 This Document is Provided by Leagle.com
petitionerยtimeยtoยprepareยhisยdefenseยandยsomeยaccessยtoยmaterialsยandยwitnessesยwhichยare
fundamentalยtoยaยmeaningfulยrightยofยrepresentation.ยMilton,ย767ยF.2dยatย1446,ยcitingยFaretta,ย422ยU.S.
atย818,ย95ยS.Ct.ยatย2532.ยMoreover,ยtheยNinthยCircuitยstated:
WeยneedยnotยdetermineยinยthisยcaseยwhetherยBounds,430ยU.S.ย817,ย97ยS.Ct.ย1491,ย52ยL.Ed.2dย72,ยwhich
involvedยanยunrepresentedยprisonerยseekingยcollateralยreviewยofยhisยconviction,ยshouldยbeยinterpretedยas
placingยanยaffirmativeยdutyยuponยtheยstateยtoยprovideยaยlibraryยforยtheยdefendantยwhoยhasยrejectedยthe
assistanceยofยcounselยforยtrial.ยFarettaยcontrolsยthisยcase.
Milton,ย767ยF.2dยatย1446.7
TheยNinthยCircuitยdeclinedยtoยstateยtheยeffectยofยBoundsย(ifยany)ยonยprisonersยwhoยareยpreยญtrial
detaineesยdecliningยcounsel.
Theยcourtยcannotยfailยtoยnoteยtheยironyยofยtheยsituationยwhereยaยpreยญtrialยdetaineeยrepresenting
himself,ยandยwhoยtherebyยhasยaยgreatยneedยforยlibraryยaccess,ยwillยbeยdeniedยthatยaccess.ยPlaintiffs
argueยthatยtheยpreยญtrialยdetaineeยisยbeingยpenalizedยforยtheยassertionยofยhisยFarettaยrights.ยOnยtheยother
hand,ยtheยstateยshouldยnotยhaveยtoยsubsidizeยtheยexerciseยofยFarettaยrightsยwithยrespectยtoยlibrary
accessยforยpreยญtrialยdetaineesยwhenยitยalreadyยprovidesยaยmoreยthanยadequateยsubstitute.ยDefendants
contendยthatยaยcountyยmayยcertainlyยchooseยtoยgiveยBoundsยaccessยtoยaยlawยlibraryยinยadditionยto
appointedยcounsel,ยbutยitยisยnotยmandatedยtoยdoยso.
Therefore,ยtheยremainingยissueยisยwhetherยanyยaccessยtoยaยlawยlibraryยisยmandatedยbyยMilton,
andยifยso,ยtheยparametersยofยthatยaccess.ยTheยNinthยCircuitยhasยnotยexpressedยanยentirelyยconsistent
positionยonยthisยissue.ยInยTaylorยv.ยList,880ยF.2dย1040ย(9thยCir.1989),ยtheยNinthยCircuitยwasยfacedยwith
aย42ยU.S.C.ยยงย1983ยclaimยbyยaยconvictedยdefendantยthat,ยbecauseยheยhadยbeenยdeniedยaccessยtoยa
lawยlibraryยwhenยheยwasยrepresentingยhimself,ยheยhadยsufferedยaยconstitutionalยdeprivation.ยTaylor
interpretedยMiltonยasยfollows:
WeยthenยwentยonยtoยholdยthatยtheยSixthยAmendmentยrightยtoยselfยญrepresentationยrecognizedยinยFaretta
includesยaยrightยofยaccessยtoยlawยbooks,ยwitnesses,ยandยotherยtoolsยnecessaryยtoยprepareยaยdefense.
Taylor,ย880ยF.2dยatย1047.
UnderยtheยTaylorยholding,ยclearlyยsomeยaccessยtoยaยlawยlibraryยisยrequiredยforยtheยincarcerated
preยญtrialยdetainee.ยHowever,ยoneยyearยlaterยtheยNinthยCircuitยappearedยtoยrestrictยaccessยtoยaยlaw
libraryยwhenยitยstated:
Asยthisยcourt'sยdecisionยinยWilsonยsuggests,ยthereยisยnothingยconstitutionallyยoffensiveยaboutยrequiringยa
defendantยtoยchooseยbetweenยappointedยcounselยandยaccessยtoยlegalยmaterialsอพยtheยsixthยamendmentยis
satisfiedยbyยtheยofferยofยprofessionalยrepresentationยalone.
UnitedยStatesยv.ยRobinson,ย913ยF.2dย712,ย717ย(9thยCir.1990),ยcert.ยdenied,ย___ยU.S.ย___,ย111
S.Ct.ย1006,ย112ยL.Ed.2dย1089ย(1991)ย(emphasisยadded).8ยHarmonizingยtheยauthority,ยthisยcourt
believesยthatยanยincarceratedยpreยญtrialยdetaineeยisยentitledยtoยaยlimited,ย"nonยญBounds"ยaccessยtoยlaw
booksยandยotherยlegalยmaterials.ยThisยcourtยalsoยfindsยthatยtheยcountyยisยnotยobligedยtoยfacilitateยnonยญ
lawyerยlegalยassistanceยforยtheยpreยญtrialยdetainee.
Additionally,ยtheยcourtยnotesยthatยtheยweightยofยauthorityยinยotherยcircuitsยthatยhaveยconsideredยthis
issueยsupportsยtheยcourt'sยconclusionยthatยdefendantsยareยnotยmandatedยtoยsupplyยBounds/Toussaint
accessยtoยlawยlibrariesยorยlegalยassistance.ยUnitedยStatesยv.ยChatman,584ยF.2dย1358ย(4thยCir.1978)
(toย extentย Boundsย evenย applies,ย stateย satisfiedย Boundsย withย theย offeringย ofย counselย for
representation)อพยUnitedยStatesยexยrel.ยGeorgeยv.ยLane,718ยF.2dย226,ย231ย(7thยCir.1983)ย(offerยof
courtยญappointed
www.leagle.com/PrintDocument.aspx 5/9

6/20/12 This Document is Provided by Leagle.com
[ย780ยF.Supp.ย1315ย]
counselย toย representย aย defendantย satisfiesย theย constitutionalย obligationย ofย aย stateย toย provideย a
defendantยwithยlegalยassistanceยunderยtheยSixthยandยFourteenthยAmendments)อพยUnitedยStatesยv.
Pina,844ยF.2dย1,ย5,ยn.ย1ย(1stยCir.1988)ย(whenยaยdefendantยrefusesยassistanceยofยappointedยcounsel
heยhasยnoยrightยtoยunqualifiedยaccessยtoยaยlawยlibraryยorยtheยmaterialsยtherein)อพยUnitedยStatesยv.
Smith,907ยF.2dย42,ย44ย(6thยCir.),ยcert.ยdenied,ย___ยU.S.ย___,ย111ยS.Ct.ย521,ย112ยL.Ed.2dย533ย(1990)
(noย interplayย betweenย Boundsย andย Farettaย thatย wouldย requireย aย trialย courtย toย permitย aย proย se
defendantยtoยhaveยaccessยtoยaยlawยlibrary).ยAlthoughยtheยNinthยCircuitยhasยseeminglyยavoided
explicitlyยholdingยthatยtheยstatesยmayยsatisfyยFarettaยbyยofferingยappointedยcounselยonly,ยcaseยlaw
fromยtheยotherยcircuitsยcarriesยsomeยauthoritativeยweight.ยThus,ยtoยtheยextentยthatยotherยcircuitsยhave
determinedยthatยBoundsยdoesยnotยrequireยtheยstatesยtoยprovideยphysicalยlibraryยaccessยtoยpreยญtrial
detaineesยwhoยexerciseยtheirยFarettaยrights,ยthisยcourtยisยpersuaded.
Theย onlyย remainingย issueย isย howย muchย accessย willย satisfyย thisย court'sย "someย access"
requirement.ย Defendantsย haveย submittedย declarationsย inย whichย theyย indicateย thatย theย County
providesย someย accessย toย legalย materials,ย witnessesย andย otherย toolsย necessaryย toย prepareย a
defense.9ยAccordingยtoยtheยEarlesยdeclaration,ยtheยjailยlibrarianยprovidesยaย"proยper"ยinformation
package.ยAยpersonยrepresentingยhimselfยalsoยreceivesยcopiesยofยtheยapplicableยcodeยsection(s)
relatedยtoยhisยchargesยandยrulesยofยcourt.ยTheยCountyยalsoยprovidesยseveralยinformationยpackets
pertainingยtoยMarsdenยmotionsย(ineffectiveยassistanceยorยconflictยwithยcounsel),ยhabeasยcorpus,
acquisitionยofยexperts,ยcriminalยmotions,ย42ยU.S.C.ยยงย1983ยactionsยandยseveralยotherยareas.ยInยorder
toยobtainยspecificยlawยbooks,ยtheยinmateยsubmitsยaย"kite"ยtoยcustodyยstaff.ยTheยrequestยmayยbeยfor
specificย referenceย materials,ย orย aย moreย generalizedย requestย forย booksย inย aย certainย legalย area.
Personsยrepresentingยthemselvesยcanยobtainยlegalยmaterialsยwithinยaยdayยofยaยrequestอพยtheยgeneral
inmateย populationย canย obtainย requestedย referencesย withinย aย week.ย Theย lawย librarianย willย also
"Shepardize"ยtheยcasesยprovidedยtoยtheยinmateยuponยrequest.
Plaintiffs'ย declarationsย describeย thisย systemย asย workingย moreย poorlyย inย practiceย thanย itย is
theoreticallyยsupposedยtoยwork.ยHowever,ยtheยcourtยfindsยforยtheยpurposesยofยplaintiffs'ยinterlocutory
injunctiveยreliefยmotion,ยthatยwhateverยtheยinvalidityยofยaยpagingยsystemยwithยrespectยtoยincarcerated
prisonersยafterยconviction,ยseeยToussaint,ยandยitsยinevitableยbreakdownยinยsomeยcases,ยaยpreยญtrial
detainee'sยSixthยAmendmentยFarettaยrightsยareยsatisfactorilyยsupplementedยbyยtheยaccessยprovided
byยtheยCountyยJailยpersonnel.
Therefore,ยtheยcourtยfindsยthatยalthoughยtheยplaintiffsยhaveยraisedยseriousยlegalยissuesยwith
respectย toย lawย libraryย accessย forย preยญtrialย detainees,ย theyย haveย notย raisedย seriousย questions
concerningยtheยlikelihoodยthatยtheyยwillยultimatelyยreceiveยinjunctiveยrelief.ยThisยcourtยhasยresolvedยthe
legalยquestion,ยandยitยnoยlongerยremains.ยThereยisยnoยfurtherยdevelopmentยofยtheยissueยwithยrespectยto
preยญtrialยdetaineesยinยthisยcaseยthatยwouldยlikelyยchangeยtheยresult.10ยAccordingly,
[ย780ยF.Supp.ย1316ย]
plaintiffs'ยrequestยforยinjunctiveยreliefยforยpreยญtrialยdetaineesยrepresentingยthemselvesยinยtheirยcriminal
actionsยisยdenied.
V.ยConvictedยPrisoners11
Turningยtoยtheยclaimsยofยtheยotherยgroupยofยplaintiffs,ยtheยconvictedยprisoners,ยBoundsยclearly
applies.ยThus,ยinยconsideringยplaintiffs'ยrequestยforยinjunctiveยrelief,ยtheยcourtยmustยconsiderยwhether
defendantsยhaveยmetยBoundsยbyยprovidingยeitherยmeaningfulยaccessยtoยanยadequateยlawยlibraryยor
adequateยassistanceยofยpersonsยtrainedยinยtheยlaw.ยFirst,ยwithยrespectยtoยtheยclaimsยofยinadequate
www.leagle.com/PrintDocument.aspx 6/9

6/20/12 This Document is Provided by Leagle.com
accessย toย aย lawย library,ย plaintiffsย areย clearlyย correctย thatย aย "paging"ย orย "slip"ย systemย aloneย is
unconstitutional.ยToussaintยv.ยMcCarthy,ย801ยF.2dยatย1080ย(9thยCir.1986).ยAsยnoยoneยdisputesยthat
theยSacramentoยCountyยJailยusesยaยslipยsystem,ยitยwouldยappearยatยtheยthresholdยthatยtheยlawยlibrary
failsยtoยprovideยconvictedยinmatesยwithยtheยrightยofยaccessยtoยtheยcourts.
Althoughย aย pagingย systemย aloneย isย unconstitutional,ย someย authorityย supportsย defendants'
argumentยthatยaยpagingยsystemยinยconjunctionยwithยlegalยassistanceยwillยsatisfyยBounds.ยWilliamsยv.
Leeke,584ยF.2dย1336ย(4thยCir.1978),ยcert.ยdenied,ย442ยU.S.ย911,ย99ยS.Ct.ย2825,ย61ยL.Ed.2dย276
(1979)ย(stateยcouldยuseยpagingยsystemยinยconjunctionยwithยprovidingยstateยญfundedยlegalยcounselยor
trainedย legalย assistants)อพย Seeย also,ย Toussaint,ย 801ย F.2dย atย 1109ยญ1110.ย Defendantsย attemptย to
distinguishยtheirยsystemยfromยtheยToussaintยpagingยsystemยbyยclaimingยthatยtheyยalsoยprovideยlegal
assistanceยtoยtheยinmates.ยDefendantsยnoteยthatยoneยofยtheยlibrariansยisยaยcertifiedยparalegalยandยthat
bothยlibrariansยassistยtheยinmatesยbyยobtainingยgeneralยreferences,ยnarrowingยtheยscopeยofยlegal
inquiriesย andย providingย inmatesย withย compiledย packagesย ofย legalย materialsย andย forms.ย Thus,
defendantsยcontendยthatยtheirยsystemยisยcompletelyยdifferentยfromยtheยToussaintยsystemยwhere
inmatesยhadยtoยuseยexactยcitationsยinยorderยtoยobtainยlegalยreferences.
However,ยitยisยquestionableยwhetherยdefendantsยhaveยprovidedยtheยnecessaryย"legalยassistance"
toยcircumventยtheยunconstitutionalยpagingยsystem.ยTheยproblemsยwithยtheยToussaintยpagingยsystem
areยnotยlimitedยtoยtheยrequirementยofยprovidingยexactยcitations.ยInยorderยtoยconductยmeaningfulยlegal
research,ยprisonersยmustยbeยallowedยtoยbrowseยthroughยlegalยmaterials.ยWilliams,ย584ยF.2dยatย1339
(legalย researchย oftenย requiresย browsingย throughย variousย materialsย inย searchย ofย inspiration).
Defendantsยcannotยalleviateยtheยproblemsยofยaยpagingยsystemยmerelyยbyยprovidingยassistanceยin
locatingยcitations.ยInยaddition,ยalthoughยdefendantsยattemptยtoยcharacterizeยtheยassistanceยofยtheยlaw
librariansยasย"legalยassistance,"ยitยisยunclearยwhetherยthisยtypeยofยassistanceยwillยsatisfyยBounds.
See,ยe.g.,ยWilliams,ย584ยF.2dยatย1339อพยToussaint,ย801ยF.2dยatย1110ย(citingยotherยcircuitยauthority
definingยlegalยassistance).
Becauseยplaintiffsยhaveยraisedยserious,ยnonยญspeculativeยquestionsยconcerningยtheยconstitutional
adequacyย ofย theย pagingย systemย forย convictedย prisoners,ย theย courtย willย presumeย aย showingย of
irreparableยinjury.ยHowever,ยtheยgrantยorยissuanceยofยinterlocutoryยinjunctiveยreliefยdependsยuponยthe
balanceยofยhardships.ยPlaintiffsยhaveยnotยshownยthatยtheยCounty'sยpresentยsystemยadverselyยaffects
manyยconvictedยinmates.ยMoreover,ยplaintiffs'ยgeneralยrequestยthatยthisยcourtยorderย"physicalยaccess
toยtheยlawยlibrary"ยisยdevoidยofยanyยpracticalยspecifics.ยShouldยtheยcourtยorderยtheยCountyยtoยinitiateยan
escortยsystemยwithยtheยattendantยcostsยassociatedยwithยaยsecurityยescort?ยShouldยtheยcourtยorder
theยplacementยofยtheยlawยlibraryยinยaยnewlyยconstructedยspace?12ยHowยshouldยaย"jailhouseยlawyer"
legalยassistanceยplanยbeยinitiated?ยWithoutยknowing
[ย780ยF.Supp.ย1317ย]
theยspecificsยofยtheยpresumptiveยharmsยentailedยinยtheยinadequateยlawยlibraryยaccessยclaim,ยand
withoutย havingย finallyย adjudicatedย whetherย theย County'sย "pagingย systemยญplus"ย meetsย the
requirementsยofยBounds/Toussaint,ยtheยcourtยisยunwillingยtoยassessยatยthisยtimeยtheยprobableยheavy
costsยassociatedยwithยtheยrequestยforยrelief.
However,ยplaintiffsยalsoยrequestยthatยdefendantsยpostยaยlistingยofยallยlegalยreferencesยavailableยin
theยlawยlibraries.ยDefendantsยdoยnotยassertยanyยdifficultyยorยhardshipยwouldยariseยoutยofยpostingยa
copyยofยtheยreferenceยmaterialsยavailableยinยtheยjailยlawยlibrary.ยAยcopyยofยtheยreferenceยlistingยcould
beยconspicuouslyยpostedยinยtheยdayroomsยonยtheยseveralยfloorsยofยtheยjailยfacility.ยTherefore,ยthis
courtยwillยorderยtheยplacementยofยaยcopyยofยtheยlistingยofยlegalยreferenceยmaterialsยcontainedยinยthe
MainยJailยandยRCCCยinยaยconspicuousยplaceยonยeachยfloorยofยtheยlivingยareas.
CONCLUSION
www.leagle.com/PrintDocument.aspx 7/9

6/20/12 This Document is Provided by Leagle.com
Inยaccordanceยwithยtheยcourt'sยaboveยญstatedยreasoningยandยitsยannouncementsยtoยtheยpartiesยin
openยcourt,ยITยISยHEREBYยORDEREDยthatยplaintiffs'ยrequestยforยaยpreliminaryยinjunctionยregarding
lawยlibraryยaccessยisยdenied,ยwithยtheยexceptionยthatยdefendantsยareยorderedยtoยpostยtheยlistsยofยlegal
referenceยmaterialsยasยstatedยpreviously.
Footnotes
1.ยPlaintiffsยfiledยtheirยthirdยamendedยcomplaintยonยSeptemberย25,ย1991.ยInยtheirยthirdยamendedยcomplaintยplaintiffs
purportยtoยrepresentยbothยprisonersยinยtheยSacramentoยCountyยJailยandยtheยRioยCosumnesยCorrectionalยCenter.
Defendantsยhaveยchallengedยtheยsufficiencyยofยthisยthirdยamendedยcomplaintยbyยfilingยaยmotionยtoยdismiss.ยAยhearingยis
scheduledยonยdefendants'ยmotionยforยNovemberย21,ย1991.
BackยtoยReference
2.ยInยseveralยofยtheยdeclarations,ยplaintiffsยraiseยclaimsยconcerningยconditionsยofยconfinementยotherยthanยlawยlibrary
access.ยHowever,ยtheseยissuesยareยnotยcurrentlyยbeforeยtheยcourt.ยTherefore,ยtheยcourtยonlyยconsidersยthoseยallegations
relatedยtoยlawยlibraryยaccess/legalยassistance.
BackยtoยReference
3.ยFurther,ยitยisยclearยfromยtheยplaintiffs'ยdeclarationsยthatยatยleastยsomeยplaintiffsยallegeยactualยinjury.ยSeeยtheยdeclarations
ofยHamburgยandยMarks.
BackยtoยReference
4.ย Again,ย defendantsย haveย notย studiedย plaintiffs'ย declarations.ย Plaintiffsย Kaiserย andย Marksย complainย aboutย the
inaccessibilityยofยjailhouseยlawyers,ยasยwellยasยaยdenialยofยphysicalยaccessยtoยtheยlibrary.
BackยtoยReference
5.ยTheยcourtยwillยaddressยdefendants'ยargumentsยconcerningยclassยcertificationยinยfullยonยNovemberย21,ย1991,ยwhenยthe
courtยconsidersยdefendants'ยmotionยtoยdismiss.
BackยtoยReference
6.ยForยeaseยofยreference,ยtheยtermย"preยญtrialยdetainees"ยwillยbeยusedยnotยonlyยtoยencompassยthoseยpersonsยawaitingยtrial,
butยalsoยthoseยpersonsยwhoยrepresentยthemselvesยinยcriminalยpostยญtrialยproceedings.ยWithยrespectยtoยtheยpresentยclass,
noยpartyยcontestsยtheยfactยthatยpreยญtrialยdetaineesยhaveยtheยrightยtoยappointedยcounselยforยtheirยcriminalยproceedings.
BackยtoยReference
7.ยTheยMiltonยcourtยcitedยUnitedยStatesยv.ยWilson,690ยF.2dย1267ย(9thยCir.1982),ยcert.ยdenied,ย464ยU.S.ย867,ย104ยS.Ct.ย205,
78ยL.Ed.2dย178ย(1983),ยwhichยdefendantsยargue,ยwithยsomeยmerit,ยunequivocallyยdecidedยthatยaยpreยญtrialยdetaineeยwho
wasยofferedยcounselยhadยnoยrightยtoยaยlawยlibraryยaccess.ยMiltonยheldยthatยWilsonยwasยconsistentยwithยitsย"someยaccess"
holding.
BackยtoยReference
8.ยHowever,ยRobinsonยgoesยonยtoยciteยMiltonยforยtheย"someยaccess"ยrequirement,ยwhichยMiltonยderivedยfromยtheยSixth
Amendment.
BackยtoยReference
9.ยTheยHonorableยWilliamยRidgewayย(SuperiorยCourtยJudge)ยexplainsยtheยCounty'sยgeneralยpolicyยforยproviding
assistanceยtoยproยperยcriminalยdefendants.ยAdditionally,ยJackยEarlesย(lawยlibrarian)ยindicatesยthatยthisยgeneralยpolicyยwas
followedยforยeachยofยtheยplaintiffsยwhoยsubmittedยdeclarations.ยTheยCounty'sยpolicyยrequiresยtheยSacramentoยCountyยJail
toยfurnishยaยplaceยtoยprepareยtheยdefenseยofยtheยcase,ยfurnishยtheยdefendantยwithยsuppliesย(i.e.ยpaper,ยpencils,ยetc.),ยallow
theยdefendantยtoยreceiveยlegalยmaterials,ยpermitยtheยdefendantยtoยhaveยupยtoยtenยbooksยinยhisยcellยatยoneยtime,ยallowยuse
ofยaยtelephone,ยaidยdefendantยinยsubpoenaingยwitnessesย(maximumยofยfour),ยprovideยunlimitedยlegalยmailยprivileges,
authorizeยtheยuseยofยanยinvestigator,ยandยinยญjailยvisitsยwithยprospectiveยwitnesses.
BackยtoยReference
10.ยTheย"seriousยquestions"ยfactorยinยtheยinjunctiveยreliefยanalysisยisยmoreยappropriatelyยdirectedยatยquestionsยofยmixed
factยandยlaw.ยPurelyยlegalยissues,ยalthoughยtheyยmayยbeยcloseยandยdifficult,ยareยusuallyยresolvedยwithoutยtheยneedยfor
www.leagle.com/PrintDocument.aspx 8/9

6/20/12 This Document is Provided by Leagle.com
furtherยdevelopmentยofยtheยrecordย(e.g.ยmotionsยtoยdismissยorยsummaryยjudgment).ยOnceยtheยcourtยmakesยaยlegal
determination,ยtheยlosingยpartyยdoesยnotยgenerallyยhaveยanyยfurtherยhopeยforยsuccessยonยthatยparticularยlegalยissue.
However,ยtheยcourt,ยofยcourse,ยisยnotยfinallyยrulingยonยtheยissue.ยIfยplaintiffsยpresentยevidenceยthatยtheยpagingยsystemยworks
soยpoorlyยonยanยoverallยbasisยthatยtheยsystemยdoesยnotยevenยprovideย"someยaccess",ยtheยmatterยwillยbeยrevisitedยatยtimeยof
finalยadjudication.
BackยtoยReference
11.ย"ConvictedยPrisoners"ยincludesยthoseยpersonsยwhoยareยpotentiallyยeligibleยtoยfileยhabeasยcorpusยpetitionsยor
participateยinยotherยcivilยactions.ยTheseยpersonsยhaveยnoยrightยtoยappointedยcounsel.
BackยtoยReference
12.ยTheยpresentยspaceยisยsufficientยonlyยtoยshelveยtheยreferenceยmaterials.
BackยtoยReference
